description:
I would give this 5 Stars but there are two reasons I won't and I'll put these up front. This application is not FOSS, and it doesn't run on mobile.

This application is great because it's "free", and Cross-Platform, and it takes advantage of Pandoc to do all sorts of document conversion. Then whatever Pandoc does, obviously you can do that too.

This application also has some superior rendering of different code types. I am a huge user of Mermaid-JS diagrams and this renders them in-line like the rest of its markdown capabilities.

This application can render Markdown in-line, realtime so you don't have to run two panes of the same thing, or render it each time. It just happens. That's the secret sauce magic of this application.
summary: One of the best and feature rich Markdown editors around!

description: Typora, cross platform Markdown editor, i find markdown a year ago and i like it, it like i can write document in simple way but structured, typora made it easy, and i like the file browser system in here , which i cannot found in other markdown editor

Well this is simply the most powerful writing experience I have ever used.

Basically I can use this now as my goto for documents instead of my office suite with onlyoffice..

So many features !

Nonsense! After saving my work, when I opened it again it says failed. I can't even recover my work.

Waste of my time.

It's very fast to work with this app, I specially loved the fast it is to write math formulas and the code highlight.But there's a problem, it doesn't open files with spaces in the name directly from nautilus, you must open typora and then open the file from the menu.
summary: Very useful once you get used to it

description:
There's an annoying bug with this version of Typora that makes it impossible to open any file if the directory has a space anywhere in it. That's not a difficult thing to solve.

The app is very useful in all other regards
summary: Had to switch to the tarball version

description: My favourite writing app on any os - simple efficient & great looking
Very nice and usefull!
Perfect to edit your Markdown favorites.

The app itself is superb. This is how a markdown editor should be! You can use the WYSIWYG view, where you get the finished formatted document, or you can use the source view where you se the unformatted text, unlike e.g. Obsidian where you only get the raw text.

Code blocks are excellent, with syntax highlighting for lots of different languages. Basically, the shiznitz. Only downside is Electron and that Snap/Flatpak are not that great. Using tarball.
summary: Great app - Flatpak and Snap isn't so great

description: The UI can be improved. And apparently the app will only be free during beta.
This is the first md editor that I actually like. Mark Text is similar (and FLOSS) but lacking i a lot of features.
summary: Not FLOSS but the way MD editors should all be

description: This version does not show windows border
summary: This version does not show windows border

description: No window border (Gnome)
it's a good program in general, but the window titlebar is missing
Really good app. costs 15$.. I'll probably buy it unless I find something better in the next few minutes.
Missing titlebar
Can't boot the app. Otherwise, I have always enjoyed using. Will delete when this issue is resolved.

Amazing app, however the latest Flatpak release has issues and won't start out of the box on some Linux distros. The partial solution is to run it from the command prompt with 

flatpak run io.typora.Typora --headless --no-gpu

This should make it work fine, but it is missing some window decoration. I hope the maintainers fix it soon, espeially considering it is a paid app for many of us.
summary: Great app, a bit buggy package (partial solutiOn below)

description: Can't save any files.
As the title says. This app is very fast, reliable, elegant.
summary: Fastest way to write down documents

description:
Just a perfect editor of Markdown with HTML support and mathematical texts. It allows creating and navigating easily complex formatted texts. With export in many formats with WYSIWYG.
It is easy and simple to use
Typora is my goto editor for markdown when I don't want the distraction of formatting symbols showing in the application. It's also cross-platform.

Eines muss man halt einfach mal sagen: Der Editor von Typora ist einer der besten für Markdown. Die grafische Darstellung hat eine gute Balance zwischen fertigem Dokument und dem Markdown-Zeichen, man sieht direkt wie das Dokument aussehen wird, und dank der vielen Themes ist es leicht ein gutes Design für den Zweck zu finden.

Allerdings fällt es bei der Nutzung immer wieder (im schlechten Sinne) auf, dass es halt doch nur eine Web-App und keine native Anwendung für Linux ist.

Beim Editor ungeschlagen bedeutet für mich halt immer noch nicht perfekt für das Dokumente schreiben, wenn das Programm nicht sauber läuft.

Clean interface, full of features, no bugs found by me, and a fast developement and bugfixing.

The only con, not open source :(
summary: For me the best markdown app

description: Clean and very useful. It requires a valid license as it is now a paid application.
La aplicacion es muy buena pero no me deja guardar absolutamente nada
This app do not see printer anymore.
我认为这是最好的mrakdown编辑器
